policy.name: WordPress 4.7 Content Injection

rules.comment:
If WordPress 4.7.2 is installed then the configuration files for the REST API will reflect that.

Please note: the default directory location for the WordPress files may vary depending on where the Web Root of the web server is located, and whether the end-user has installed WordPress in the root directory or a sub-directory.  It may be necessary to adjust the paths present in the checks below.

checks.suggestion:
If the 4.7.2 version string is not present in the file, then that version is not present on the system.

If this check does not find a file, but WordPress is installed, it may be necessary to update the file path to reflect the location of the WordPress installation on the system.

If the 4.7.2 version string is not present in the file, then that version is not present on the system.

If this check does not find a file, but WordPress is installed, it may be necessary to update the file path to reflect the location of the web server and the WordPress installation on the system.

rules.name: Is WordPress 4.7.2 installed

policy.description: To address the Content Injection vulnerability in WordPress 4.7.0 and 4.7.1
